awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase II:  Transforming Complex Utility Transaction Management
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase II project is empowering the 68 million U.S. natural gas consumers and their transaction managers and partners to access transaction status in real time, enjoy continuous control of their transactions, settle transactions in time scales less than the industry’s current monthly accounting cycle, and enjoy heightened levels of security. The United States natural gas industry has operated in its present physical form for more than a century, and over the past four decades the industry has evolved through various policy and regulatory actions to open transaction participation to thousands of parties. In other industries, the past two decades have introduced digital capabilities that share transaction information and automate select functions, but these developments have not enjoyed infusion in natural gas transaction management processes. The proposed solution will serve as a platform for industry innovation by multiple parties, reducing transaction cost and increasing speed. This innovation will have applications in other industries characterized by complex, multi-party transactions.  

This SBIR Phase II project proposes to advance blockchain innovations and related technologies to transform complex natural gas utility transaction management processes across production, transmission, distribution and consumption functions. The proposed solution will accelerate the development of third-generation smart contracting frameworks with user-friendly/interactive human-machine-interfaces (HMI) and predictive and interactive smart contracting functionalities based on artificial intelligence, and with advanced cybersecurity measures.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
EnergyXchain, LLC was founded in 2018 to develop and deploy smart contract, blockchain and distributed ledger technology software to enable transformative energy transaction management. The company initially targeted the U.S. natural gas industry ? where purchase and sale transactions require weeks to close, have remained largely unchanged for decades, and settlement risk is very high, but has designed its technology such that it has equal applicability in sectors such as hydrogen, carbon attribution tracking, electricity and other non-energy commodities. The company also believes its technology offers an ideal solution for the climate-related disclosures proposed by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, in particular quantifying Scope 3 disclosures.

 

The company?s technology concept has been vetted by numerous energy companies and funding agencies. In 2019 and 2020, the company received National Science Foundation SBIR grants (Phases I & II) as well as a 2019 grant from the North Carolina Department of Commerce. EnergyXchain concluded its Phase II work in December 2022. Beginning in 2019 and extending through 2022, the company filed three patent applications embodying its technology discoveries:

1)     Application 17/565998: Managing Energy Transactions using Distributed Ledger Technology

2)     Application 17/565865: Creating, Monitoring and Updating Energy Transactions Using Distributed Ledger Technology and Contract Codex: and

3)     Application 17/826842: Environmental Impact Attribution for Energy Production and Fulfillment Using Distributed Ledgers.

Patent application 17/565998 has been allowed and was published. Patent application 17/565865 has been allowed an is scheduled to be published January 15, 2023. Patent application 17/826842 is pending, subject to accelerated examination, and is expected to be allowed and published in early 2023.

EnergyXchain continues its work to commercialize the technologies embodied in the two allowed patents an one patent pending. An image depicting the complexity of energy transactions managed by EnergyXchain?s patented technologies appears below.

 


Last Modified: 01/02/2023
Modified by: David Doctor

Image
